documents.title: our live coverage across the day
text: regular live coverage on this page has ended for the day , but breaking news , sport and travel updates will continue to appear through the night .
east midlands live returns from 08:00 tuesday morning

documents.title: weather : patchy clouds for the evening ahead
text: it will be cloudy for the rest of this evening with the possibility of some patchy rain in the early hours .
tomorrow will be cloudy with some bright spells where the cloud thins and breaks .
expect some showery rain , which could be heavy at times , moving eastwards tomorrow evening with highs of 12c ( 54f ) .
author: Alexandra Hamilton
BBC weather presenter

documents.title: fundraising recipe book available now
text: chef hazel paterson is one of many cooks that feature in our do your food friday thing recipe book , which was compiled by bbc radio leicester .
it includes recipes from leicestershire chefs and is available now priced at £ 7.50 .
all profits will go to bbc children in need .

there are various locations across leicestershire where you can it up , including delilah 's fine foods in leicester , charnwood brewery in loughborough , north deli in rothley and melton sports in melton mowbray .
author: Children in Need

documents.title: travel : tram disruption in nottingham
text: disruption to service : due to a failed tram at highbury vale , we currently have no service between phoenix park and highbury vale .
customers should use the tram to bulwell , then from bulwell bus station , the nct 79 and 79a will accept our tickets as far as cinderhill,1/2
would be good if you put this on the website as well .
plus what about people who ca n't walk from cinderhill to phoenix park and vice versa ?
hi claire we do have acceptance from nct to use the 35 79 or the 79a to cinderhill from bulwell bus satation
i know that , but i have someone coming into the city to meet me who does n't know nottingham .
your lack of correct information has caused a lot of stress but he 's figured it out now despite your 'help ' .
we are really sorry for this claire .
you would think you 'd have a plan for when these things happen
hi claire , we do our best to have plans available however every situation is different so there is not a plan that will work for every eventuality .
the information was poor , there was no staff at the various stops , messages referred you to the website & the website was n't updated .
plus you never answered how you got to phoenix park-a major park & ride .
you must have a contingency for that !
sorted now but things to feed back .
hi claire , all feedback is passed to our senior management team who continually look for how we can improve .
thanks for your feedback today .
are they not going to actually drop us off at phoenix park ?
they will be able to get you cinderhill
shit cunts
sort your trams out .
spend some money or give refunds .
so many disruptions in the last few months .
unfortunately , it is n't a rapid transit system .
that would have required a more competent system design , less failure and a better recovery system .
what 's with the lack of toton lane trams all the time the last 3 at the train station have all been clifton bound
do we need to get off if we want moor bridge or further ? ?
no clear messages !
close to our phoenix park tram stop .
when will there be a tram from the station to toton lane ?
no updates on that yet
there should be a tram just pulling in now
unable to get on .
too busy .
thanks a lot !
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : overnight m1 closures this week
text: if you 're driving overnight on the m1 this week watch out for these closures until thursday .
# m1 j24 to 23a : full southbound overnight closure from 9pm to 6am between monday 20 and thursday 23 november .
plan your journey .
can you travel southbound on a453 from nottingham to east midlands airport at 4am tomorrow waaaa
hi you can travel on the a453 southbound from nottingham to the roundabout with j24 of # m1 but then the section of the a453 to the airport is closed .
sometimes works can finish early , please call us before you travel and we can check your route for you - 03001235000 .
oh so i need to go via the other side of donnigton ?
thanks for the late night help - should have been more organised before an early trip
hi yes you need to go to the other side of donnington .
no problem , at least you know now before you get there .
hope you have a safe trip .
are there any closures tonight on m1 before j19 northbound ?
and is m6 j1-2 northbound closed at nights still ?
hi david .
m6 northbound j1-j2 closed mon-fri nights 2100-0600hrs until 09/12 , though advice is to check before setting off .
what section of m1 are you looking at prior to j19 ?
where can i check of planned closures ?
i can never find the correct information when i search .
thanks
would advise you to use to search by road , but if something is n't clear then we are here 24/7 .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: man suffers broken jaw in assault
text: a 45-year-old man suffered a broken jaw when he was assaulted twice in one evening .
derbyshire police said the man was punched and kicked to the ground on saturday .
officers have released a cctv image of a man they want to speak to in connection with the assault .
it happened between 12:05 and 12:30 in ilkeston market place .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: transport secretary praises nottingham station
text: the transport secretary , mp chris grayling , has praised nottingham railway station and city transport system .
he visited nottingham earlier today and said the city was a `` real exemplar on how to build an integrated transport hub in the heart of the city '' .
mr grayling also praised the £ 150m refurbishment of the station which has seen it link trains with the tram network , car park and cycle hub .
he said : `` i very much support local initiatives designed to try and get people onto public transport where there is a smart public transport system like this .
`` and what nottingham has done with the tram shows you can really deliver growth in a whole variety of ways . ''
it comes as the government today announced £ 1.7bn of money for regions to improve transport links between cities and suburbs , called the transforming cities fund .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: clumber park shot in springwatch blog
text: this beautiful shot of the sun peeking through the trees at clumber park in nottinghamshire has been included in a bbc blog of stunning autumn
read the bbc springwatch blog here .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your chasing rainbows in derbyshire
text: some impressive rainbow photographs across derbyshire this afternoon .
here 's ripley .
a double rainbow over belper .
and here 's one in chesterfield .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: 'extremely rare ' african banknotes stolen in leicestershire
text: these `` extremely rare '' african banknotes have been stolen from a house in leicestershire .
two men entered a property in syston road , queniborough , on thursday between 11:50 and 12:10 and took the notes along with jewellery and cash .
they made off in a vehicle which was parked in rearsby road behind the house .
police are urging pawnbrokers and antique dealers to contact them if they have been approached by someone trying to sell the seven 100 shilling notes .
det con richard wilson said : these african 100 shilling notes are extremely rare and we are sure the perpetrators will try and sell these notes on . ''
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: teenager charged after stabbing
text: a 17-year-old boy has been charged with grievous bodily harm following an `` incident '' in aspley .
nottinghamshire police said a man suffered facial injuries on saturday in broxtowe lane .
about half an hour later , east midlands ambulance service said another man suffered a stab wound to his chest .
the teenager was arrested shortly afterwards and is due to appear at nottingham youth court today .
a 16-year-old boy , who was arrested yesterday , remains in police custody .
two other youths , aged 15 and 19 , have been bailed pending further inquiries .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: horse coins stolen in burglary
text: these collectible coins with images of famous racehorses inscribed on them have been stolen from a property in nottingham .
the break-in happened at brownlow drive in rise park earlier this month .
the distinctive coins were stolen alongside jewellery and cash .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: dozens of guns handed in during surrender
text: more than 50 weapons and 600 rounds of ammunition were handed in to leicestershire police in the first week of a national firearms surrender .
the firearms that were handed in include five shotguns , three revolvers - including one from world war two - 22 blank firers , pistols , flare guns and air weapons .
forces across the country are taking part in the surrender , which started last week .
it is not , however , an amnesty - police can investigate offences connected to the weapons prior to their surrender .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: m1 crash : lanes open , delays remain
text: all lanes open and hgvs recovered on the # m1 northbound between j23a @ twitterid and j24 # kegworth .
delays remain as far back as j23 on the # m1 n/b and the a42 n/b between a453 and m1/a453 .
have a safe journey
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cricket : bowler jake ball says he is fit for selection
text: the nottinghamshire fast bowler jake ball says he is fit and available for selection for england in the first ashes test against australia on thursday .
ball 's place has been in doubt because of an ankle injury he up in a warm-up match but he says he 's a 100 % fit .
author: BBC Nottingham Sport

documents.title: fox rescued after sewage fall
text: this fox got itself into a rather sticky situation in chesterfield .
luckily derbyshire fire and rescue and the rspca were on hand to rescue it .
11:45 # chesterfield red assisted @ twitterid with equipment to allow rspca officer mick to rescue a fox from a sewage treatment culvert
thank you for helping to rescue such a lovely little chap - the work you do is so very much appreciated !
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rapist jailed for sex attacks on girls
text: rapist jailed for sex attacks on girls

documents.title: two lanes closed on the m1
text: delays are building up on the m1 between junctions 23a and 24 for kegworth northbound because of an accident .
it happened in the roadworks area and has closed two lanes .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: unique royal portraits created for queen 's anniversary
text: these unique pieces of art have been created to mark the queen and prince phillip 's 70th wedding anniversary today .
the portraits of both royals were created by joy pitts , from ilkeston , using name tags like those sewn into school uniforms .
each label displays the name of a soldier who died in world war one .
buckingham palace wrote to the artist to tell her the queen was touched by her work .
joy 's pieces will be displayed at the makers gallery in ashbourne this week .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: rapist jailed for sex attacks on girls
text: a 63-year-old man has been jailed for 18 years for sexually abusing three girls over a 30-year period .
ian warren , of no fixed address , was found guilty at nottingham crown court on friday of 27 sexual offences including rape and sexual activity with a child .
nottinghamshire police said one of warren 's victims was abused at a house in nottingham and another in derbyshire .
one girl was abused between 1980 and 1985 , another from september 2008 to december 2010 ; and the third girl was attacked between november 2008 and november 2011 .
pc ruth holmes , from the force , said : `` warren 's victims have shown exceptional bravery [ and ] have conducted themselves admirably . ''
warren was placed on the sex offenders ' register for life and was handed an indefinite sexual harm prevention order .
he will serve an additional two years on licence on top of the 18 years jail time .
author: Sonia Kataria
BBC News Online

documents.title: mental health centre faces closure after funding cuts
text: a charity that supports people with mental health issues is fighting to remain open after losing its funding .
the touchwood centre in ilkeston is run by erewash mental health association and currently has 40 regular users .
bosses say it has lost funding from both derbyshire county council and erewash clinical commissioning group .
the closure would mean four job losses at the centre in ilkeston .
director lesley grand-scrutton said : `` if we do n't get any further funding we shall probably have to close in probably six to eight months time .
`` our previous funding was about £ 100,00 on an annual basis but anything we can get will help us stay open longer . ''
derbyshire county council says it 's investing £ 620,000 in a new recovery and support service .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather : showers potential
text: plenty of cloud around but a few gaps and breaks developing bringing some slightly brighter weather .
there is still , however , the potential for a couple of showers on a breezy afternoon with highs of 13c ( 55f ) .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: teens arrested after armed robbery
text: staff at a nottingham off-licence were threatened with a knife and a baseball bat during a robbery last night , police said .
the robbers stole a large quantity of cigarettes and bottles of alcohol from valley farm stores in knight 's close , top valley at about 19:40 .
they also reportedly tried to smash their way into the shop 's till before fleeing the scene .
two 16-year-old boys and a 15-year-old boy remain in police custody .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: missing precious harris found
text: officers searching for precious harris say she has been found .
nottinghamshire police said the 14-year-old went missing from rise park yesterday .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: nottingham christmas lights switched on
text: hundreds of families flocked to the old market square in nottingham for the christmas lights switch-on .
the event on friday kicked off with performances from st mary 's church choir and live music from singers .
the council house and the surrounding streets has been decked out with lights while the christmas tree has taken centre stage in the market square .
nottingham 's mayor mike edwards and the sheriff glyn jenkins switched the lights on although there was a slight technical glitch which saw the lights go out for a few seconds before coming back on .
but visitors enjoyed winter wonderland and the ice bar , which has a narnia-esque theme this year .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: listen : anna soubry speaks of death threats
text: broxtowe mp , anna soubry , said her office has received 13 death threats against her .
she said they were linked to the way she and other conservatives were dubbed as `` brexit mutineers '' in the daily telegraph .
the paper has not yet commented .
the bullying begins .
we want a good brexit not a hard ideologically driven brexit # standupfordemocracy
@ twitterid my late husband and his two brothers fought in ww2 and up to the day they died were committed europhiles.dont try to speak for them .
are you sure you 're a europhile ?
it appears to have lost it 's original meaning and is now used to denote someone who is an admirer of europe and an admirer of the european union .
the two are not the same .
many europeans love their continent but are opposed to the european union .
the worst kind of poll - a vox pop '' that feeds into prejudice and is based on the kinds of lies that nazis like to write on the side of a bus .
the facts are much more useful
hardly surprising you do n't like it .
you probably think leavers voted because of a bus .
more of them did than would care to admit it .
the manipulation was widespread , powerful and effective .
the social media bubbles are pretty tough to break out of so most do n't bother
how do you know that more of them did than would care to admit it ?
i suppose you 'd say that their denial is merely them being 'embarrassed ' .
do you assume that the bus is the only reason they voted leave , that arguments about laws , money and borders were irrelevant to them ?
what arguments about laws ?
every time a brexiter was asked what eu laws that wanted rid of they went red , shat their pants and then made their excuses .
common agricultural policy , fishing policy and immigration policy are three .
now , can you name me a single eu regulation that the uk can unilaterally amend or repeal whilst a member of the eu ?
you might think that uk domestic policy is best decided by eu as a whole but i do not .
verify your account .
full of hyperbole but you have n't got the courage of your own convictions .
cowardy custard .
my account is verified and yours is n't .
yours is filtered out because your account is unverified .
propaganda comes easy to you .
your account is verified because you spout what they want there may come a time when you realise who pulls your strings.unfortunately you sit in a demographic of the easily manipulated .
verify your account cowardy custard .
haha # standupfordemocracy you 're doing exactly the opposite
here are the real enemies of the people .
# stopbrexit # brexitcrisis # euwithdrawalbill
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: your golden autumn in the east midlands
text: leaves continue to fall across the region and you 've been out capturing some stunning scenes .
here 's autumn in all its golden glory on the cromford canal , derbyshire .
here 's a leaf-strewn scene in market warsop , nottinghamshire .
and increasingly bare trees in kegworth in leicestershire .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: police operation to tackle black mamba problems
text: there have been 80 arrests made in recent months as part of two operations to tackle the use of drugs such as black mamba and s in derby .
a report by derby city council says st peter 's cross is a hotspot for anti-social behaviour which is caused by just 20 users .
there will be a temporary mobile police station based in a police van at st peter 's cross for two weeks during the daytime .
but the local authority says the increased police presence means there is a danger users will move elsewhere in the city .
the report also says funding cuts to local support services have played a part in the growth of the drugs .
the city council says it has put in `` significant resources '' in the last few months to tackle the problem .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: notts still in transition - nolan
text: notts still in transition - nolan

documents.title: have you seen precious harris ?
text: officers are concerned for the safety of precious harris who has gone missing .
the 14-year-old went missing from rise park in nottingham at about 17:00 yesterday , nottinghamshire police said .
she was last seen wearing a black nike puffa coat with a white north face t-shirt underneath , black ripped jeans and nike trainers .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 70 years of wedding dresses for queen 's anniversary
text: wedding dresses from seven decades have gone on show at leicester cathedral to mark the queen and prince philip 's 70th wedding anniversary .
the exhibition , called crown of love , also includes bouquets and flowers and runs until thursday .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: football match held in memory of adam johnson
text: a memorial football match for adam johnson took place in mickleover this weekend .
the 12-year-old died in september after falling through the roof of the abandoned aida bliss factory in chester green .
on sunday , friends and family staged a game to help pay for a memorial to adam but the family are yet to decide on exactly what that will be .
his mum kerry said : `` adam would have absolutely loved this , he would have loved everyone coming and he loved football anyway .
`` really , really emotional but extremely grateful for everyone that has put this on for us today . ''
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: work planned at nottingham station
text: if you 're planning on catching a train from nottingham this week , look out for work taking place on the middle footbridge .
passengers are advised to use the main station stairs at the end of the platforms .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'we had a sense of victory for the first time '
text: 'we had a sense of victory for the first time '
author: Greig Watson
BBC News

documents.title: mi6 's secret multi-million pound cold war slush fund
text: a document unearthed in the national archives by a university of nottingham academic has revealed a confession from an mi6 chief in 1952 .

sir stewart menzies - known as `` c '' - revealed to a minister that for close to a decade , he had an account that would become known as the `` unofficial reserve '' - in practice his own , secret slush fund .

`` the use of such unofficial reserves by 'c ' without the prior consent of the foreign office , could enable him to carry out policies other than those approved by the foreign office and without their knowledge , '' the document records .
researcher dr rory cormac said it was a `` bombshell of an inheritance '' .
but questions remain .
where did the money - about £ 1.4m ( £ 39m in today 's money ) - come from ?
what did it make possible ?
who was the mysterious american who donated it - and why did they do it ?
security correspondent , gordon corera 's report is on document on bbc radio 4 at 20:00 tonight .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: three teens arrested after stabbing
text: two men remain in a serious but stable condition after an `` incident '' in aspley .
nottinghamshire police said a man suffered facial injuries on saturday at about 11:35 in broxtowe lane .
about half an hour later , east midlands ambulance service said another man suffered a stab wound to his chest .
broxtowe lane between eltham drive and ainsdale crescent was closed on saturday while officers carried out investigations .
three people , aged 15 , 17 and 19 were arrested on sus of grievous bodily harm and remain in custody .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: friend 's 'premonition ' before daniel hegarty 's fatal race
text: a friend of a motorcyclist killed in a crash at the macau grand prix said he had a strong feeling something .
daniel hegarty , 31 , from nottingham , ( below ) suffered fatal injuries when he came off his bike on a sharp bend .
roger edwards , who helped the father-of-two with his motorbike charity , said he had trouble sleeping before the race in china and feared for the rider .
mr edwards said the sportsman was `` magical '' and a great friend .
mr hegarty , who raced for top gun racing honda , was flung into barriers during lap six and suffered fatal injuries .
he died on the way to hospital .
author: Neil Heath
BBC News Online

documents.title: hospital opens new unit for emergency patients
text: as the weather gets increasingly colder , the pressure on a & e departments across the region will inevitably increase .
at leicester royal infirmary , a new assessment unit has opened in a bid to reduce the burden on the city 's emergency department .
the gp and ambulatory care unit will treat patients referred by their own doctors as an emergency .
some patients from the hospital 's own emergency department and others who 've been discharged and need follow-up appointments will be referred to the unit .
hospital bosses hope it will reduce unnecessary admissions this winter .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: jehovah 's witnesses 'covered up ' abuse
text: jehovah 's witnesses 'covered up ' abuse

documents.title: broken down vehicle causes m1 delays
text: a broken down vehicle on the m1 between junctions 29 for chesterfield and 28 alfreton southbound is causing delays this morning .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: weather for the east midlands
text: here 's how it 's looking today
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: work on broadmarsh car park attracts visitors
text: the demolition of broadmarsh car park in nottingham has reached the halfway mark .
it is part of the wider , multi-million pound redevelopment of the area and the new car park is expected to be ready in late 2019 .
but the demolition itself has become something of an attraction for passers-by .
andrew , a security guard at nottingham crown court , says the work is attracting more than 100 people at a time .
`` it is probably because the building has been around for a very , very long time so people are probably amazed at the transformation . ''
work started in july and is expected to take six months .
from the 20,000 tonnes of material from the site , more than 99 % will be recycled , 75 % of all the waste rubble will go towards creating new roads and buildings locally .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: 'unofficial ' tram plans published
text: proposals for up to nine new tram lines serving nottinghamshire and beyond have been published online .
but nottingham city council and gedling borough council say it is nothing to do with them .
they have made it clear that the plans are not official even though the website does include costings paid for by a suggested tax on retail parking spaces .
if the proposals are given the go-ahead , the routes would include arnold , cotgrave , keyworth , giltbrook and even derby .
those behind the website have n't responded to our inquiries .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live

documents.title: victims 'told not to report ' jehovah 's witness child abuse
text: children who were sexually abused by jehovah 's witnesses were allegedly told by the church not to report the crimes .
male and female victims from across the uk - including in leicester - have told the bbc they were routinely abused and that the religious organisation 's own rules protected perpetrators .
one child abuse lawyer believes there could be thousands more victims .
the church said it did not `` shield '' abusers .
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: travel : latest on east midlands roads
text: travel : latest on east midlands roads
author: Dave Wade
BBC Local Live

documents.title: join us for today 's live coverage
text: good morning nottinghamshire , derbyshire and leicestershire .
dave wade and i will be writing the updates on today 's live page with all the latest news , sport , weather and travel .
if you 'd like to get in touch with us , you can send an email , or use facebook or twitter .
author: Maryam Qaiser
BBC Local Live
